main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects in the United States during the period of 29 March to 17 April 1950.
interesting points: The objects were rectangular in shape, approximately 34 feet long and 11 feet thick, with amber coloring and entirely flat surfaces.
The formation of objects exhibited erratic but definite patterns of acceleration, deceleration, and lateral movement.
Each object in the formation constantly changed its position, causing the entire formation to rise and fall in a smooth coordinated up and down movement.
The estimated loss and gain of altitude with each up and down movement was approximately 1,000 feet.
The sightings occurred in different locations: Alabama, California, and Texas.
